startPage=-1, endPage=-1, consolidateCitations=1, consolidateHeader=1, consolidateFunders=0, includeRawAffiliations=false, includeRawCitations=true, includeRawCopyrights=false, generateTeiIds=false, generateTeiCoordinates=[], flavor=null

div.p: Accurate knowledge of rare earths (REE: La-Lu, +Y, Sc) speciation in high P-T fluids is of critical importance to understand and better model the role of fluids in formation of rare earths deposits. The aim of this experiment was to investigate La speciation and solubility in high temperature fluids involving different complexing ligands and pH, conducting in situ XAS measurements. These experiments will extend the experimental dataset on REE aqueous chemistry that has been developed since 2014 and enable the development of new depositional models for the REE.

All users must give proper credit to ESRF staff members and proper mention to ESRF facilities which were essential for the results described in any ensuing publication. Further, they are obliged to send to the Joint ESRF/ ILL library the complete reference and the abstract of all papers appearing in print, and resulting from the use of the ESRF.
Should you wish to make more general comments on the experiment, please note them on the User Evaluation Form, and send both the Report and the Evaluation Form to the User Office.

div.head: Deadlines for submission of Experimental Reports
div.p: -1st March for experiments carried out up until June of the previous year; -1st September for experiments carried out up until January of the same year.

div.head: Instructions for preparing your Report
div.p: • fill in a separate form for each project or series of measurements.
• include the reference number of the proposal to which the report refers.
• make sure that the text, tables and figures fit into the space available.

• if your work is published or is in press, you may prefer to paste in the abstract, and add full reference details. If the abstract is in a language other than English, please include an English translation.
La speciation in high P-T fluids: Implications for the remobilization of REE by hydrothermal fluids and the formation of rare metals deposits.

div.head: Experiment number:
div.p: Date of experiment: from: 23 Jan 18 to: 30 Jan 18 Date of report: 08 Feb 18 Shifts: Experimental Data were collected at the La L 3 -edge (5483 eV) at the BM-30B (FAME) beamline, using the high T-P autoclave developed by the Institut Neel. Sample Conditions Sample Conditions La 2 O 3 Pellet Sol7: La 2 O 3 + H 2 SO 4 30-450 o C, 400 bar La 2 CO 3 F Pellet Sol8: La 2 O 3 + Na 2 CO 3 200-450 o C, 400 bar LaCl 3 Pellet Sol9: LaCl 3 + 4.5m LiCl 30-550 o C, 400 bar LaF 3 Pellet Sol10: La(NO 3 ) 3 + Li 2 SO 4 + H 2 SO 4 30-400 o C, 400 bar Sol2: La 2 O 3 + 1 m HCl 30-450 o C, 400 bar Sol11: La(CH 3 COO) 3 + CH 3 COOH 30-400 o C, 400 bar Sol3: La(NO 3 ) 3 30-400 o C, 400 bar Sol13: La in 0.3m Cl 30-450 o C, 400 bar Sol4: La 2 O 3 + Na 2 SO 4 200-400 o C, 400 bar Sol14: La 2 O 3 + 0.7 m Na 2 CO 3 + 0.35 m NaF 300-500 o C, 400 bar Sol6: La 2 O 3 + Na 2 SO 4 + H 2 SO 4 30-100 o C, 400 bar Sol15: La 2 O 3 + 0.67 m Na 2 CO 3 + 0.6 m NaF 30-500 o C, 400 bar

div.head: General observations
div.p: 1. La follows the same dehydration effect observed for other rare earths in that (i) the total number of ligands decreases and (ii) the number of Cl ligands increases. 2. Even in rather salty solutions, the uptake of Cl into the first coordination sphere is limited. Preliminary results suggest 1.5(4) Cl + 3.5(9) O are coordinated to La in a 4.5 m LiCl solution at 550 o C (Sol 9). 3. Observations in nature by Migdisov et al. (2016) indicate that some metal transport should occur under basic conditions. We tested this observation by measuring La 2 O 3 in Na 2 CO 3 ± NaF solutions and the results were astonishing -XANES with a demonstable step were observed at 300 o C and nice XANES could be obtained at 400 o C. The EXAFS are short range (La L 2 edge is 408 eV above the La L 3 edge) and rather noisy, but a rough "qualitative fit" may be obtainable. 4. La-SO 4 solutions -the solubility decreased quite dramatically with increasing temperature. The only solution with refinable EXAFS is Sol7 (highly acidic).

biblStruct.note: eg see effect of salt above

Sol8: Na 2 CO 3 Sol14: 0.7 m Na 2 CO 3 + 0.35 m NaF Sol15: 0.67 m Na 2 CO 3 + 0.6 m NaF Effect of adding salt Sol13: 0.3 m Cl Sol2: 1 m HCl Sol9: 4.5 m LiCl Effect of SO 4 2-: difficult to determine bidentate La-S bond, due to high noise in spectra, eg see effect of salt above.

analytic.title: Skimpflation Outrage: Decreases in Product Quality are Seen as Much More Unfair Than Decreases in Size and Increases in Price

biblStruct.note: Sol4 & Sol6: La is not very soluble in these solutions Sol7: solubility decreases with increasing T Sol10 -solubility > than for Sol4 and Sol6, but not much, and decreases with T.

analytic.title: Figure 4—figure supplement 1. Processing of rotation information during long-duration motion.

biblStruct.note: Impact These measurements at the La edge complement previous efforts by M. Louvel (Experimental 2017*) and Louvel, Brugger and Etschmann (Experimental report 30-03 1102, ES-550) to improve the characterization of REE aqueous compounds in high temperature fluids that resemble those involved in the formation of economic rare earth ore deposits 3) a short communication on metal transport in basic conditions and (4) the data will be used to ground-proof up-coming molecular dynamics calculations

Impact These measurements at the La edge complement previous efforts by M. Louvel (Experimental reports 30-02- 1089 and 30-02-1096 -Louvel et al., 2015*), Brugger and Etschmann (Experimental report 30-02 1088, Liu et al. 2017*) and Louvel, Brugger and Etschmann (Experimental report 30-03 1102, ES-550) to improve the characterization of REE aqueous compounds in high temperature fluids that resemble those involved in the formation of economic rare earth ore deposits (e.g., Bayan Obo, China; Strange Lake, Canada). A number of publications are expected from this work: (1) the structure of REE complexes with OH, Cl and S ligands in high P-T fluids and (2) the influence of P-T conditions and fluid composition on the solubility, transport and deposition of the REEs in geological environments should come out of these two years work, (3) a short communication on metal transport in basic conditions and (4) the data will be used to ground-proof up-coming molecular dynamics calculations (Y, La).

analytic.title: Hydrothermal controls on the genesis of REE deposits: Insights from an in situ XAS study of Yb solubility and speciation in high temperature fluids (T < 400 °C)

biblStruct.note: *Louvel & Mavrogenes, 2015, 'Hydrothermal controls on the genesis of REE deposits: Insights from an in situ XAS study of Yb solubility and speciation in high temperature fluids (T<400C)'. Chemical Geology, vol 417., pp. 228-237

analytic.title: Revisiting the hydrothermal geochemistry of europium(II/III) in light of new in-situ XAS spectroscopy results

biblStruct.note: *Liu, Etschmann, Hazemann, Testemale, Migdisov and Brugger, 2017. Revisiting the hydrothermal geochemistry of europium(II/III) in light of new in-situ XAS spectroscopy results. Chemical Geology, 459, 61-74.
